## Bond duration is a simple risk management tool that Silicon Valley Bank 
overlooked, but it can help you manage your retirement portfolio by 
controlling sensitivity to interest rate risk.

With the Silicon Valley Bank collapse fresh in everyone\'s mind, this is a
great opportunity to discuss interest rate risk: what it is, how it
impacted SVB, and how you can manage it in your retirement portfolio.

Interest rate risk refers to the potential for changes in interest rates to negatively affect the value of an investment. Typically, this risk
affects fixed-income investments such as bonds, where the value of the
bond can fluctuate in response to changes in prevailing interest rates.
When interest rates rise, the value of existing bonds decreases, as the
interest rate being paid by the bond is now lower than the prevailing
interest rate. Conversely, if interest rates fall, the value of existing
bonds increases. To put it differently, the value of a bond is
negatively correlated with the current interest rates.This is a post with executable code.


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
1 + 1
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] 2
```
:::
:::
